gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Class LogScaleColorModel

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.LogScaleColorModel

public class LogScaleColorModel
extends java.lang.Object

This class maps floating point values to colors. The pseudo-color scale may be specified to be any of the named color scales from the IndexColorMaker class. The range of values in the array must be set before colors may be returned. The values are scaled logarithmically before being mapped to the pseudo-color scale. If the array contains negative values, one of the "dual" color models from the IndexColorMaker should be used. The shape of the log function used for the scaling can be adjusted to control the apparent brightness of the color.

See Also:
PseudoLogScaleUtil, IndexColorMaker

Field Detail

COLOR_MODEL

public static final java.lang.String COLOR_MODEL
"Color Model" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the IndexColorModel used. The value referenced by this key is a String name constant from IndexColorMaker.java.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOG_SCALE

public static final java.lang.String LOG_SCALE
"Log Scale" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the log scale table used to map data values to colors within the colorscale. The value referenced by this key is an array of bytes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TWO_SIDED

public static final java.lang.String TWO_SIDED
"Two Sided" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about displaying the data. If one-sided, negative data will be mapped to zero and a one-sided color model will be used, where as two-sided data will remain negative and be mapped to colors on a two-sided color model.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

LogScaleColorModel

public LogScaleColorModel()
Constructor. Sets color model to heated color scale 2 with dual color mode. The logarithmic scale is initialized to zero, i.e. linear scale.

Method Detail

setLogScale

public void setLogScale(double s)
Change the control parameter for the logarithmic scaling applied to the data values. If the data has negative values, the logarithmic scaling is applied to the absolute value of the values.

Parameters:
s - The control parameter, s, clamped to the range [0,100]. If s is 0, the scale is essentially linear. If s is 100, the relative intensity of small values is greatly increased so the image is lightened.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameter is outside of bounds.

setNamedColorModel

public void setNamedColorModel(java.lang.String color_scale_name,
                               boolean twosided)
Change the color model to used for the image. If the data has negative values, one of the "Dual" color models should be used.

Parameters:
color_scale_name - Name of the new color scale to use. Supported color scales are listed in the IndexColorMaker class.
twosided - Flag that determines whether a color scale that includes colors for both positive and negative values is used, or if only positive values are represented.
See Also:
IndexColorMaker

getNamedColorModel

public java.lang.String getNamedColorModel()
Get the name of the color model currently set.

Returns:
Name of the color scale being used. Supported color scales are listed in the IndexColorMaker class.
See Also:
IndexColorMaker

isTwoSideModel

public boolean isTwoSideModel()
Determine if "dual" color model is being used. If true, then color scale includes colors for negative and positive numbers. If false, color scale only includes colors for positive numbers.

Returns:
True for two sided model, false otherwise.

setDataRange

public void setDataRange(float data_min,
                         float data_max)
This method will set the data range to [data_min,data_max].

Parameters:
data_min - The minimum data value mapped to the minimum color.
data_max - The maximum data value to be mapped to the max color.

Get the minimum value of the data represented.

Returns:
min_data

public float getDataMax()

Returns:
max_data

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(float data_value)
Generates the color from given data value based on set color scale with applied logarithmic scaling. If the data has negative values, the logarithmic scaling is applied to the absolute value of the values.

Parameters:
data_value - The data value that gets mapped to a color.
Returns:
The color for that data value.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If data_value is outside of value range.
